00011     bool is_thread_started(const boost::thread& thread) {
00012         return thread.get_id() != boost::thread::id();
00013     }
00014 }

00016 SimulationControl::SimulationControl() : processing_time_factor_(1000), current_processing_time_(0)  {
00017

00024 void SimulationControl::create_new_simulation(const std::string& configuration_filename, std::size_t history_length) {
00025     // terminate the old simulation including the old simulation thread.
00026     terminate_simulation();
00027 
00028     //set up a new history
00029     // TODO:
00030     // std::size_t history_length = simulation_kernel->history_length_(); //project parameter?
00031     // std::size_t history_length = 123;
00032     // craupach: I changed history length to be a parameter to this method.
00033     // I don't like it being in the project file for following reasons:
00034     // * It does not really influence how the simulation will develop
00035     // * We would need to parse it out of the project file ourselves. If its passed a parameter
00036     //   the project file needs only be touched in SimKernel
00037     // * We may want to rerun the same project with different history lengths for collecting statistics
00038     // * We can easily pass it in the UI or as a commandline parameter
00039     history_.reset(new History(history_length));
00040 
00041     // create and initialize new kernel. History should be passed here because the init method
00042     // of the SimulationKernel will need it to construct EventHandler, ASG, StatisticKernel.
00043     boost::shared_ptr<SimulationKernel> simulation_kernel(new SimulationKernel());
00044     simulation_kernel->init(configuration_filename, history_);
00045 
00046     simulation_kernel_functor_.reset(new SimulationKernelFunctor(simulation_kernel));
00047 
00048     current_processing_time_ = 0;
00049 }
00050 
00051 void SimulationControl::start_simulation() {
00052     if(!is_thread_started(simulation_thread_)) {
00053         boost::thread simulation_thread(boost::bind(&SimulationKernelFunctor::loop, simulation_kernel_functor_));
00054         simulation_thread_.swap(simulation_thread);
00055 
00056         //fetch first two WorldInformations
00057         current_world_information_ = history_->get_oldest_unused(true);
00058         next_world_information_ = history_->get_oldest_unused(true);
00059 
00060         //some initialization
00061         current_processing_time_ = current_world_information_->time() * processing_time_factor_;
00062         last_process_simulation_time_ = boost::posix_time::microsec_clock::local_time();
00063     }
00064     else {
00065         simulation_kernel_functor_->unpause();
00066     }
00067 }
00068 
00069 void SimulationControl::pause_simulation() {
00070     if(is_thread_started(simulation_thread_)) {
00071         simulation_kernel_functor_->pause();
00072     }
00073 }
00074 
00075 void SimulationControl::terminate_simulation() {
00076     if(is_thread_started(simulation_thread_)) {
00077         simulation_kernel_functor_->terminate();
00078         //note: terminate above will have no effect if the thread is blocked, so unblock it
00079         history_->get_oldest_unused();
00080 
00081         simulation_thread_ = boost::thread();
00082         simulation_kernel_functor_ = boost::shared_ptr<SimulationKernelFunctor>();
00083     }
00084 }
00085 
00086 void SimulationControl::process_simulation() {
00087     double new_processing_time = compute_new_processing_time();
00088 
00089     // Try and get the two world informations matching our processing time.
00090     // This may skip world informations if we are processing too fast.
00091     // (may happen if the simulation time distance between two world informations
00092     // has a high variance. We would need to dynamically adjust the processing time factor
00093     // if we would want to avoid this).
00094     // If the Simulation has not produced the needed world informations yet, we pause
00095     // the processing time.
00096     double current_simulation_time = new_processing_time/processing_time_factor_;
00097     while(current_simulation_time >= next_world_information_->time()) {
00098         boost::shared_ptr<WorldInformation> new_world_information = history_->get_oldest_unused();
00099         if(!new_world_information) {
00100             //try_wait failed
00101             //proceed processing_time to next_world_information time instead of setting it to new_processing_time
00102             //-> pauses processing_time at next_world_information_->time()
00103             current_processing_time_ = next_world_information_->time() * processing_time_factor_;
00104             break;
00105         }
00106         else {
00107             current_world_information_ = next_world_information_;
00108             next_world_information_ = new_world_information;
00109             current_processing_time_ = new_processing_time;
00110         }
00111     }
00112 
00113     // draw the simulation state for the current processing time if there is a visualizer.
00114     if(visualizer_) {
00115         double extrapolation_time = current_processing_time_/processing_time_factor_ - current_world_information_->time();
00116         visualizer_->draw(extrapolation_time, current_world_information_);
00117     }
00118 }
00119 
00120 double SimulationControl::compute_new_processing_time() {
00121     boost::posix_time::ptime current_time = boost::posix_time::microsec_clock::local_time();
00122     boost::posix_time::time_duration time_elapsed = current_time - last_process_simulation_time_;
00123     last_process_simulation_time_ = current_time;
00124     return current_processing_time_ + time_elapsed.total_milliseconds();
00125 }

00127 SimulationControl::SimulationKernelFunctor::SimulationKernelFunctor(boost::shared_ptr<SimulationKernel> simulation_kernel)
00128                                                 : terminated_(false), paused_(false), unpaused_(1), simulation_kernel_(simulation_kernel) {
00129 
00130 }
00131 
00132 void SimulationControl::SimulationKernelFunctor::unpause() {
00133     if(paused_) {
00134         paused_ = false;
00135         //set unpaused to 1
00136         unpaused_.post();
00137     }
00138 }
00139 
00140 void SimulationControl::SimulationKernelFunctor::pause() {
00141     if(!paused_) {
00142         paused_ = true;
00143         //set unpaused to 0
00144         unpaused_.wait();
00145     }
00146 }
00147 
00148 void SimulationControl::SimulationKernelFunctor::terminate() {
00149     terminated_ = true;
00150 }
00151 
00152 void SimulationControl::SimulationKernelFunctor::loop() {
00153     while(!terminated_) {
00154         //wait if unpaused == 0
00155         unpaused_.wait();
00156         unpaused_.post();
00157 
00158         simulation_kernel_->step();
00159     }
00160 }
